# supportsDuplex

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the printer supports printing on both sides of a sheet of paper.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var supportsDuplex: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the printer supports double-sided printing or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] if it does not. For printers you create yourself using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrinter/init(url:)] method, the value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] until you successfully connect to the printer using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrinter/contactPrinter(_:)] method.

## Getting the printer information

- **displayName**: The human-readable printer name.
- **displayLocation**: The human-readable text that describes the location of the printer.
- **makeAndModel**: A string that contains the manufacturer’s name and the model name of the printer.
- **supportedJobTypes**: The capabilities of the printer.
- **UIPrinter.JobTypes**: Constants that indicate the types of jobs that the printer supports.
- **supportsColor**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the printer supports color printing.
